Summary I am deeply passionate about Community Development, improving social participation and cohesion and am interested in pursuing opportunities within this space. I have a particularly strong background in Relationship Management, Promotion, Coaching and Training and Team Leadership.  
 
My current roles are within the non-profit sector. At AMES I am focused on Promoting our education programs and services for migrants and refugees and am known for building strong Stakeholder Relationships with a shared sense of purpose. My work with The Welcome Dinner Project sees me more directly involved in Community Engagement and Volunteer Management to create a platform for meaningful connections between newly arrived and established Australians.  
 
With over 7 years Team Leadership experience managing and motivating highly engaged, customer focused teams, I am a results driven and emotionally intelligent leader. I build successful, change ready teams who share a vision and proactively work towards common goals. My roles within Management and Learning and Development have honed my skills as a Coach, Facilitator and Presenter and I have a proven ability to build capability and embed learning.  
 
I am happy to connect and chat further via email – judit.brown@icloud.com

 Experience Coordinator - Community Development & Engagement, Relationship Management, Volunteer Management Joining the Dots 2015  – Present (less than a year) Melbourne Area, Australia The Welcome Dinner Project is the major initiative of non-profit and registered charity, joiningthedots, and brings together newly arrived people and established Australians to meet over dinner. The aim of these pot-luck-style dinners is to create a platform for meaningful connection, sparking friendships between people of diverse cultures who are living in close proximity to one another but have not had an opportunity to connect in a supported environment. It increases social cohesion by involving the broader community in building a welcoming Australian society, one which embraces and celebrates diversity. 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:  
• Volunteer role as Regional Coordinator of The Welcome Dinner Project in Northern Suburbs 
• Promote The Welcome Dinner Project to community groups and local government  
• Develop partnerships with key agencies, groups and institutions to engage both established Australians and newly arrived people 
• Monitor online registrations received from those interested in participating in and/or hosting Welcome Dinners in their communities  
• Coordinate and organise Welcome Dinners in the region  
• Liaise with facilitators, hosts and participants  
• Recruit new volunteers and facilitators  
• Identify and apply for different streams of funding and establish a local coordination team

Player Knoxville Lady Force May 2013  –  July 2013  (3 months) Soccer Camp Counselor Playing For Palmer- World Vision June 2009  –  June 2010  (1 year 1 month) Chattanooga, Tennessee Playing For Palmer was a World Vision soccer ball program, created in honor of a dear friend and teammate of Josie, Palmer Griffin. Palmer lost her fight to Leukemia at St. Jude Hospital in 2008, however her infectious spirit continued to course through the heart of the entire soccer community, especially her friends and family. In honor of her passion for the game of soccer and her infinite love for children, Josie worked with the Griffin family to help create a foundation that would provide soccer balls to children in various third world nations that had limited accessibility to soccer equipment. The summer of that same year, along with a few of their close high school teammates, Josie volunteered to help coach groups of inner city girls and teach them the general dynamics of soccer and the importance of teamwork. The ages of the campers ranged from 4 through 15 years old, most of whom had never touched a soccer ball, prior to the camp. Visions Leadership Camp Counselor Girls Preparatory School June 2008  –  July 2009  (1 year 2 months) Chattanooga, Tennessee Area For consecutive summers, Josie was of the few selected to work as a camp counselor for the Visions Leadership Camp, a 2-week grant funded camp that sought to teach young girls the qualities needed to positively impact their community and the importance of continuing their education, in order to become successful business women of our future. During each 2 week session, the small group of leaders would spend their mornings speaking with various influential leaders within the Chattanooga area, learning the necessary characteristics needed to become an influential member of the local community. The late mornings and afternoons were spent with groups of young girls, gathered from a variety of local inner-city organizations, listening to local business woman speak on leadership and performing various character building exercises. Summary *** STAFFING CONSULTANT - PROFESSIONAL COACH, LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING PROFESSIONAL *** 
 
and Matchmaker....??? 
 
I'm an entrepreneurial minded, creative professional with a passion for getting to the heart of the matter, providing exceptional customer service and connecting people and things! 
 
My skills can be applied in many realms (and have!) including; 1:1 coaching on 'life'​ stuff, corporate/leadership coaching in a more business style, retail, food & hospitality...basically anywhere authenticity is valued. 
 
Having made it through the 'pre'​ and 'post'​ dot.com boom and bust, I have learned a lot about parsing quality. In several capacities I have worked with employers to understand their needs and candidates to and glean their top experience and strengths. Putting them together is what I love! 
 
Earlier extensive experience in HR focused my strengths in Employee Relations and Learning/Training & Development. 
 
Matching experience is not limited to career related 'items. I am also a Career/Life/Success coach who helps match dynamic folks up with whatever it is they are after...even if they are not sure what that is! 
 
In addition I deliver training programs and work with leaders to hone the coaching side of their management experience.  
 
In other realms I also have fun pairing things like; delicious Italian wines with my dinner, friends to their future spouses, AND fashion lovers with items from my personal vintage collection numbering over 250 pieces. 
 
I'm always interested in expanding my network. If you would like to contact me directly please feel free to write at: coachlisad@gmail.com Summary *** STAFFING CONSULTANT - PROFESSIONAL COACH, LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING PROFESSIONAL ***

Summary Mary is part of the multi-million dollar sales training and coaching division of the 155 year old Southwestern Company. Her division also holds sales training conferences all of the United States themed, Success Starts Now!™. 
 
Mary is a mother of two. She has her Bachelor’s degree from Belmont University, and she has run her own training business, and recruited and trained numerous sales teams. 
 
With over 25 years of experience in training and development, Mary has established herself as an award winning, highly accomplished and motivated workplace training specialist, with a proven track record of rapport building, resourceful problem-solving, and communication skills. She has written various related articles, including How Much Do We Really Need. 
 
 
QUALIFICATION SUMMARY 
 
- Strong background in training corporate clients on numerous software applications and facilitating management and personal development seminars.  
 
- Talent with identifying employee’s training needs through the use of pre- and post-assessment tools, and practice ensuring training curriculum addresses the changing needs of employees. 
 
- Extensive experience with developing curriculum for classroom and reference usage. 
 
- Expertise in business management gained through over 25 plus years of experience in corporate training operations. 
 
- Highly skilled in human resource functions, including staff and management training and development, as well as recruitment, interviewing, and hiring. 
 
- Solid interpersonal, oral and written communication, liaison, and negotiation skills gained through experience in training and sales operations. 
 
- Content provider for Non-Profit and Government Grant RFPs and Contract Acquisitions. 
 
- Expert skill level in Microsoft Office, Visual Studio (VB.Net), HTML, Adobe Captivate, TelePresence Cisco. 
 
Specialties: Rapport building, resourceful problem-solving, and communication skills. Summary I’ve worn many hats in my career –developer, writer, manager, technical trainer, and coach. As a result, my manager throws me into whatever needs to be done. She knows I have a knack for learning things quickly and a history of getting assignments out the door. Within my team, I’ve become one of the go-to people for training, development, documentation, and industry questions. My time in the trenches has taught me that my professional value boils down to the following: 
•	I LOVE a challenge. Tough projects, obstacles, difficult personalities -bring it!  
•	I make the complex simple.  
•	For me, taking people to the next level is Job One. 
•	I don’t get rattled. Where there’s a problem there’s an answer.  
•	I am competitive by nature.

Summary Binnen het trainen en coachen van jeugdvoetballers beleef ik ontzettend veel plezier om spelers te leren het maximale uit zichzelf te halen. In mijn beleving is het belangrijk dat spelers zoveel mogelijk impliciet leren, samen werken om doelen te bereiken en mentale vaardigheden aangereikt krijgen om controle over zichzelf te houden in verschillende situaties. Voetballers verdienen een programma dat zoveel mogelijk individueel op maat is, elke speler is anders.  
 
Op dit moment volg ik de opleiding sportgezondheid en -management. Na in het eerste jaar mijn propedeuse te hebben behaald, studeer ik op dit moment in het tweede jaar. Binnen deze opleiding heb ik de cursus sportpsychologie succesvol afgerond. Mijn vooropleiding is CIOS MBO 4 trainer-coach. Tijdens deze opleiding heb ik het groot profiel voetbal gevolgd met als klein profielen loop- en conditietraining en fitness. Summary As a worker bee there is a lot to do. My name is Tiffany Dedeaux and I'm an Associate Certified Sacred Time Career Coach. Together we'll uncover what gets you buzzing with passion so you can identify, prepare for, or create the Dream Job that will make your life a little sweeter. 
 
I help connect you to your inner wisdom through your relationship to nature, which is known as ecopsychology. Time in nature helps you feel more alive and think 20-50% more clearly.  
 
We will bring nature into our Coaching work through 
■ Outdoor experiences 
■ Creative metaphors 
■ Meaningful stories 
 
Sacred Time, as a practice, is about setting aside time each day, week, or season for nature-driven Divine Inspiration. With me as your Coach you will discover the path that is right for you and: 
■ Make sense of your past 
■ Create purpose for your present 
■ Get excited about your future! 
 
I will help you weed out the distractions, uproot the expectations of others, and kindle the fire inside by connecting with what you truly want.  
 
Sign up for this newsletter at Sacred-Time.com/Newsletter and you will receive one month of email coaching that will help you to: 
 
■ Think like a Career CEO 
■ Create a mission & vision statement 
■ Reframe your resume 
■ Market yourself 
■ Identify what’s wrong so you can rebalance your life 
 
In addition you will get tools like: 
 
■ Knowing Your Data which will help you take stock of your career assets before you revamp your cover letter 
■ 52-Week Money Challenge so you can jump start your savings to create more freedom in your career 
 
Get out of your box. Sign up for my Career Coaching Newsletter and let’s get to work! 
 
Tiffany A. Dedeaux, MA, ACC 
SACRED TIME Career Coach | Associate Certified Coach 
US Office +1 (360) 303-1312  
http://Sacred-Time.com/Newsletter
